intro: Memecylon crassifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf memecylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Southeast Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, characterized by its large, ovate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the rainy season. Memecylon crassifolium is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
